result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Bongle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Bongle

defendant.name: Bongle, Mark A
defendant.address: 5206 Buffalo Ridge Trl, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark A Bongle in court with attorney Colleen Nordin. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor battery. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Mark A Bongle in court with attorney Colleen Nordin. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense makes statement regarding number of convictions of victim. State makes statement regarding juvenile record in Kewaunee County. Defense advises that Defendant is no longer receiving notice of victim's most recent pending case in Kewaunee. Court reviews Discovery Demand, advises State that it's their responsibility. State advises that Defense was going to get them. Defense advises that she is unable to get those records without a Court order, can't file motions without receiving information. Motions to be filed by Friday, January 23 by noon. Also to advise at same time if case is resolved.
Pre-trial conference on January 12, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark A Bongle in court with attorney Colleen Nordin. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that case is not resolved, advises of issue regarding juvenile records. Discussion regarding case being in #3 position. Court will reschedule jury trial. Discussion regarding witnesses. Set for trial and pre-trial. Pre-trial motions due 10 days before pre-trial. Discussion regarding juvenile records in Kewaunee County.
Jury trial on October 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 22, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Mark A Bongle in court with attorney Colleen Nordin.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises of investigation into victim's juvenile record, case is not resolved, requests that case be set for trial and pre-trial.  Set for trial and pre-trial.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.

Defendant Mark A Bongle in court with attorney Colleen Nordin.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark A Bongle in court with attorney Colleen Nordin.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Set prelim. Bond continues as is.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with RE, d/o/b 11/11/97; SK, d/o/b 1/14/96.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Mark A Bongle appeared by video conference.  Attorney Eric Maciolek appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.
